MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Freshford (Kilkenny) Advance Factory.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Gibbons Mr. Gibbons
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Industry and Energy when an advance factory will be built in Freshford, County Kilkenny.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Industry and Energy (Mr. Reynolds) Albert Reynolds
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for Industry and Energy (Mr. Reynolds)
Speaker.P: I am informed by the Industrial Development Authority that it is, at present, negotiating for the purchase of a 5.5 acre site at Freshford, County Kilkenny, for industrial development.
The IDA expect to finalise the purchase of this site over the next month or so and construction of a 5,000 sq. ft. advance factory on the site will commence as soon as possible thereafter.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Dublin Domestic Water Supply.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Tunney Mr. Tunney
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if he is aware that for some time past many residents in the Finglas/Ballymun area have been enduring a highly inadequate domestic water supply; and when this intolerable situation will be rectified.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: The maintenance and operation of existing public water supplies in Dublin city is a matter for Dublin Corporation. I understand from the corporation that parts of the Finglas-Ballymun area are so elevated in relation to the Ballycoolen Reservoir which supply them that it is difficult to keep water pressures at reasonable levels. Measures to overcome the problem are under consideration and a proposal is expected to be placed before the city council later this year.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Planning Permissions.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Moynihan Mr. Moynihan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if it is his intention to introduce legislation extending the life of planning permissions which under existing legislation are deemed to have expired on 31 October 1981.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Molloy Mr. Molloy
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment the present position in relation to planning permissions which were deemed to have expired on 31 October 1981; and if he will make a statement regarding his predecessor's intention of granting a further year's extension in respect of all such planning permissions.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: With the permission of the Ceann Comhairle, I propose to take Questions Nos. 300 and 302 together.

I intend to introduce legislation early in the next Dáil term to extend the duration of planning permissions, including those which cease to have effect on 31 October 1981. Until that legislation is enacted, section 29 of the Local Government (Planning and Development) Act, 1976, continues in force, and planning authorities are empowered by it to extend, or to further extend, the period of duration of a permission.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: The question of appropriate local government status for Tallaght is one which would fall to be considered in the wider context of local government structures in the Dubin area generally. MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Milltown (Dublin) Parish Hall.

Speaker.hpid: Mrs. Fennell Mrs. Fennell
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for the Environment if there are any plans to demolish the parish hall in Milltown, Dublin 6.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke) Raphael P. Burke
Speaker.NameTxt: Minister for the Environment (Mr. Raphael Burke)
Speaker.P: I presume the Deputy is referring to the Tontine Hall at Milltown which is included in a compulsory purchase order made recently by Dublin Corporation for the purposes of providing recreation ground and public walk along the River Dodder in this area. A public local inquiry in relation to the order will be held as soon as possible and following consideration of objections to the acquisition and the evidence given at the inquiry I will give my decision on the matter. At this stage, Dublin Corporation have made no definite plans for demolition of the hall.
